byline.contributor: Reporting for this article was facilitated through the support of the Pulitzer Center on Crisis Reporting.

abstract: Pyongyang Journal; entertainment options in North Korea's capital have expanded under leadership of Kim Jong-un to include water park, dolphinarium, horseback riding ring and variety of restaurants and cafes; diversions are way for Kim to demonstrate country's economic health, in defiance of sanctions, and to appeal to moneyed elite.

headline.print_headline: Ponies, Parks, Pizza: New Balms for North Korea’s Elite
headline.main: Pizzas, Pony Rides and Dolphin Shows: Balms for North Korea’s Elite

snippet: In the capital, Pyongyang, entertainment options have expanded under Kim Jong-un, giving the privileged few — and foreigners — a glimpse of a better life....
lead_paragraph: In the capital, Pyongyang, entertainment options have expanded under Kim Jong-un, giving the privileged few — and foreigners — a glimpse of a better life.
